Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @BadAss we don't call it **interest** anymore, we call it Komodo Active User Reward, in short **Reward**

Author: NedBGQ#8462

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you want to claim rewaard using Agama, you need to control your privkey. Ledger doesn't allow that. there is a work around. but, we don't officially recommend doing that as it exposes your privkey.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
If you prefer extreme security, use Ledger (no reward)
If you want to claim reward, use Komodo native, Agama, Agama Mobile, KomodoOcean-QT or Paper Wallet

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: HyperDEX crew will be making a desktop app that will create the tx to be approved by your ledger wallet, it will send the coins + reward back to the original address, with a fee of 5-7% of the claimed reward going to support the dev costs

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: It would be a few clicks and you can enjoy your reward whilst still having the protection of the ledger.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
@hyperDEX to clarify, they won't be fixing anything, we will fix their firmware, they just need to accept the PR to merge it into their code. I'm in discussion with them regarding whether they'll accept our fix but they're being a bit stubborn. Either way, we can get it to work, we just may have to build our own Ledger app that users would have to load onto your ledger (alongside the official "Komodo" app) called "Komodo Reward" or similar that you'll have to run on your Ledger to claim interest as opposed to the normal Komodo app.

This won't mean interest claiming will automatically work on their own wallets, our custom app will be needed either way, it's just with the current Ledger KMD firmware it's impossible to sign a claim TX, that's what we need the fix for.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content:
@snowdamn haha. Well the main thing with the claiming app fee is that it will go towards supporting dev costs for other tools myself and the team plan to build within Komodo. Currently HyperDEX is being self funded and due to mm 1.0's limitations, it is like having a lambo doing at 20 miles a hour and breaks down every few miles, no one wants to use that when their GM truck (centralized exchanged) can go faster. So there is no revenue and the dev costs dont stop ğŸ˜ƒ 

We tried a donation model in HyperDEX, (dont even know if we got any haha) but due to the bear market, that doesnt seem to be working either. So we are forced to look at other avenues and this seems to be a perfect fit. People would pay 5-10% of their reward claimed if it means they keep 90-95%.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Currently they keep 0% unless they want to risk playing with the privkeys

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: The alternative is to find another way to get funding, either some sort of Hyper chain or accepting work from other crypto projects

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
I have no issue with alternative GUIs, I think that's a great thing.
I jsut don't think having a whitelabel DEX that we customise with some colours and a logo is a beneficial to anyone apart from the currencies marketing department.

If they want to expand a DEX and add new features to it why not contribute to an existing project

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: no need to slap your brand name all over it

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: also, from a business point of view, once we've done two whitelabel DEXs, it would be pretty trivial to just diff the codebases, then any basic devleoper can see which files/images to update to roll their own. I don't think it's a very viable business model

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
```
If it's purely intended to be just a GUI branding and no support to make mm their own (eventually), then I agree with you
```
That has been discussed before and I was under the impression that's what @PTYX was talking about.

```
In my mind, the service should/could/would be to start with the GUI and charge as a service to eventually have their own mm
making it truely decentralized
```
I'm all for multiple mm implementations, definitely! Although I think we need to get mmv2 stable and performant and draft up a detailed spec before we can realistically go down that route.
